summary: This is a March 29, 2021 letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, transmitting discovery materials including FBI Florida records and FOIA documents. The letter references a protective order and designates the materials as confidential.

events.title: Discovery Production in Maxwell Case
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team, including FBI Florida records and FOIA documents.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, governing the handling of confidential discovery materials.

locations: Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office produced discovery materials (control numbers SDNY_GM_02743103 through SDNY_GM_02743292) to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team on March 29, 2021.
The produced materials included records from FBI Florida, some designated as confidential, and FOIA documents.
The production and covering letter are governed by a July 31, 2020 protective order, and the letter itself is designated as confidential.
The document confirms the ongoing discovery obligations of the government in the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330 (MN)).
The defense team at this time included attorneys Christian Everdell, Mark Cohen, Laura Menninger, Jeffrey Pagliuca, and Bobbi Sternheim.
